model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I have a plan to never let the bride get married to anyone else. I'm going to steal her and hide her away.
What?! That's not right, Co-workers A. You can't just take someone away like that.
But I love her and I don't want her to be with anyone else. It's the only way.
That's not love, Co-workers A. Love is about respecting someone's choices and feelings. You can't just kidnap someone and force them to be with you.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Supporting Each Other', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A reveals their recent accident to Co-workers B, who offers support and encouragement, drawing parallels to past acts of kindness.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, have you heard about my accident? ### Co-workers B: No, what happened? ### Co-workers A: I was in a car accident and lost my hands and feet. ### Co-workers B: Oh my gosh, that's terrible. Are you okay? ### Co-workers A: I'm alive, thankfully. But it's going to take some time to adjust to this new way of life. ### Co-workers B: I can't even imagine. Is there anything I can do to help? ### Co-workers A: Just being supportive means a lot to me. It's going to be a long road to recovery, and I'm going to need all the help I can get. ### Co-workers B: Of course, anything you need. Do you remember that time you pulled those two women apart when they were fighting? ### Co-workers A: Yeah, that was a crazy situation. ### Co-workers B: It just goes to show how brave and strong you are. I have no doubt that you'll be able to overcome this and come out even stronger on the other side. ### Co-workers A: Thank you, that means a lot to me. I'm trying to stay positive and focus on my recovery, but it's definitely a daunting task. ### Co-workers B: Well, just take it one day at a time. We're all here for you and rooting for you. ### Co-workers A: I just love being happy and making people happy. ### Co-workers B: That's a great attitude to have, especially after everything you've been through. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, losing my hands and feet was definitely a challenge, but I try to focus on the positive things in my life. ### Co-workers B: It's amazing how resilient you are. I'm sure your positivity has helped you through some tough times. ### Co-workers A: Definitely. It's important to surround yourself with positive energy and people who lift you up.' }
```
